data.title: Great Time!
data.text: We were just passing through Hartford but wanted lunch somewhere near the capitol.  We had a great lunch at the Red Rock enjoying the atmosphere and especially the bartender and wait staff who were very pleasant and shared some local history.

data.title: Love the fun salads... They're huge!
data.text: I love the fun salads at Red Rock... They come in what looks like a giant taco bowl/shell and they're so yummy! A family owned place with great customer service. They make you feel apart of theirs :)

data.title: Treated horribly by bartender
data.text: I recently went to the Red Rock Tavern for a retirement party on a Friday night and the woman bartender was extremely rude and borderline harassing.  I asked a question about the parking when I first arrived to make sure where I parked was okay and barely received a response from the bartender.  Then when she asked what I wanted to order, I asked about the beer selection on tap.  She responded by waving her hand over to the taps and rudely said "they're all right here."  Later on, two of my coworkers were ordering a round at the bar so we were standing at the end where the opening of the bar was.  We were all equidistant to the opening and partially blocking the path the bartender was using to get in and out of the bar.  She walked through us a few times and as we were getting ready to move, she got right in my face and rudely said "you need to move, over there, now!"  She didn't ask the two people that were standing with me to move, her negativity and rude demeanor was obviously directed at me alone.  I'm not sure why I was singled out by this bartender but I will never set foot in the Red Rock Tavern again because of the horrible way I was treated there.  I will also be calling the owner to make a formal complaint against this rude individual.  I would not recommend this bar to anyone and hope this comment is received by the owner in the event he/she is not aware of how this staff member treats the customers.

data.title: Great atmosphere
data.text: Red Rock is a fun, casual restaurant / bar. This is a great, affordable place to grab a bite to eat or a drink after work. There is ample seating both indoor and out. The staff is friendly and provide quick service. There is live music some nights.

data.title: I wish all bars were like the Red Rock!
data.text:
What can you say about a place where the owner cooks your meals and then checks to see if your satisfied?  This is an old time family run tavern where customers run from the rang of locals, politicals, insurance co folks, state workers n more.
The weekends have good quality music available in a place staffed by mostly family and friends.  This is really Hartford's Cheers.
Enjoy this warm friendly Tavern!

data.title: Its the "Cheers" of Hartford
data.text:
Perhaps I'm dating myself by comparing this to a 1980s TV show but the Red Rock Tavern is truly the place where everybody knows your name.  I love this bar, nestled a block away from the Capitol in the Frog Hollow neighborhood.  The staff is as friendly as you will find - the owner, Don, knows that customer service and experience comes first.  He'll be the first one to wave to you when you come in the door and spend time chatting with you.

The beer selection is pretty good with a local beer or two always on tap along with a mix of standard beers and imports.  The food is definitely a level above most pub fare, and a pretty extensive selection ranging from sandwiches/soups to pasta and fish/chips. Its a little meat heavy but the kitchen is very accommodating. They definitely hit the sweet spot balancing quality, quantity and value.  The eggplant parm dish will feed you for three days.  Always a nice selection of rotating specials as well.  

They have live music on Saturday nights (no cover charge) with cover bands playing a diverse mix of classics and they have DJs as well (check the web site for schedules).

There is also an intangible about this bar that is hard to describe. The customer base is incredibly diverse but its not cliquey - everyone is friendly to one another.  Its a great venue for group gatherings as well since with plenty of space.

data.title: Good food
data.text: We got the Italian burger (really good) and clam strips (average).  The atmosphere of the dining area is casual.  It's a bar, after all.  Wait staff was very attentive.

data.title: Friendly folks, OK food...
data.text: Friendly folks, OK food.  Restaurant has a new name..."Red Rock Cafe."
